features: TREE FREE, ECO-FRIENDLY facial tissue wipes made from sustainably grown bamboo, a fast growing grass, giving you a sustainable, eco friendly, green alternative to traditional tree based facial tissues
ULTRA SOFT, SAFE, & GENTLE ON SENSITIVE SKIN + lint free - making them great for cleaning smudges off eyewear cell phones, or makeup touch ups
FITS ALMOST ANYWHERE. Convenient 120 sheet rectangle tissue box fits almost anywhere you can find - place them in your kitchen, bathroom, night stand, or on your desk at work.
HYPOALLERGENIC, BIODEGRADABLE, SEPTIC SAFE, BPA free, unscented, paraben free, and non-GMO project verified, giving you full transparency and unmatched excellence
BULK PACK OF FOUR 3-Ply Tissue Flat Box - 120 Sheets Per Box, Total of 4 Boxes, 480. Caboo is accredited by the BRC Global Standards, FSC, ISO 14000, and is proudly panda friendly

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: SOFT + STRONG Bamboo's natural grass fibers produce a strong paper that is still soft for you and your Caboo! Our 3-ply paper is sturdy and soft for an impeccable clean. SEPTIC SAFE Our facial tissues dissolve quickly and naturally to keep your system running smoothly. Using non-septic safe paper leads to a build up in pipes and sewage backup. BREAKS DOWN NATURALLY Bamboo fibers break down in an average of 4-6 months. It's easy to see why Caboo is a smart choice when you compare that to the years of time it takes for tree paper to break down fully. BPA FREE BPA is chemical compound used in manufacturing that has been linked to adverse side effects in humans. We are proud to produce BPA free paper towels for you and your family.

Zero Cut. One Planted. Choosing Caboo saves trees and replants them, too. Working with the U.S. Forest service, we plant a tree for every pound of paper sold. More trees means better air, water, habitat and chance to combat climate change. We believe most people want to do better by the Earth. But where to start? We started Caboo: two brothers, a wife and a friend. Wiping out forests along with a spill or a bum just didn't make sense to us. So we figured it out, building relationships with trusted farmers, retailers and folks along the way. Ten years and two kids later, we're even more committed to making tree-free the go-to. Daily decisions like choosing Caboo do make a difference. We and the forest thank you! The paper industry clear cuts 1,000,000 acres of North American boreal forest each year. While trees may be replanted (and re-cut) the forest is gone forever. But, Trees Grow Too, Right? Yes, but the complex ecosystem that is a forest is gone forever. A forest is biodiverse. Over time, it is populated by different species of plants, animals and other living things at all stages of growth. They depend on each other, creating a complex ecosystem our climate depends on. It can't be replicated. Big Paper basically replants tree farms: only 1 or 2 species of the fastest growing trees all planted at once so they can get cut down again. This is why tree-free matters. How is Caboo a more Earth-conscious choice than recycled paper? Bamboo and Sugarcane are grasses, not hardwoods. They both grow very quickly and, after harvest, grow back just as quickly. No replanting is necessary. Unlike trees, which can take up to 30 years to grow and mature, bamboo and sugarcane grow back as quickly as in three to four months. When a tree is cut, it never grows back. How Caboo gives back. It's not just the trees impacted. Bamboo vs. Trees Tree-Free > Reused Tree Paper

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Like That They Are Sustainable, They Are Strong But Not Soft!
reviews.reviewText: I bought these during the toilet paper/facial tissue shortage, I liked the thought of using something sustainable. I have bronchial issues, these are much stronger than Kleenex and do a better job when I cough up gunk, however, when I use them to blow my nose they leave it red, definitely not soft. Sorry they aren't soft, I had planned to switch to them exclusively because they are better for the planet but until they are softer I will be a two facial tissue consumer - one box for my bronchial issues and the other for my nose.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Save The Trees!
reviews.reviewText: Love these tissues. They killed my nose when I had covid though, but I think any tissues would have. Just use some lotion.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Eco-friendly and effective
reviews.reviewText: Bamboo is a strong, effective, and eco-friendly alternative to tree-based paper products. The company also seems to have ethical standards on sourcing/recycling their (bamboo) resources, which helps promote natural resource conservation (i.e., not excessively destroy swaths of forest to replace with a monocrop).The tissues are quite strong and absorbent -- to be expected for a strong fiber source like bamboo. The value is in its effectiveness and current eco-friendlier application. Although relatively expensive now, the price may reduce if the use/demand for bamboo or more sustainable products increase...subsequentially lowering the demand/use for tree-based papers.The only downside is that these tissues are not the softest in comparison to other products. However, the manufacturers' other bamboo products (e.g., toilet paper) are competitively soft. Perhaps continued feedback can inform an adaptive process to generate more softness while maintaining an otherwise effective product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I liked that it didn't shred right up as some tissues do. It's strong enough to hold together and good for environment. It's similar in strength to a napkin but slightly softer. Unscented

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars newer uglier boxes and not a great value
reviews.reviewText: I agree with "funnyworm" and "honestopinion": I used to spend more on Cabboo tissues for three reasons and now two have gone down in 2023. First, I was willing to pay more (compared to a competitor, see below) for the attractive green boxes with nice bamboo "wallpaper" pattern; well, that's gone now, replaced with yellow (sorry, not my favorite color) and what appears to be toddler's stuffed animals' graphics. Second, the quantity per box (184) meant that I didn't have to change the boxes as often; now it's down to 160. Third is still fine, I like the rationale for the product and I actually prefer the stiffness and lack of perfumes relative to the major brands. I'm gonna switch to the other bamboo brand that is essentially the same product but a better value (hint: terrible name rhymes with "leaky" and has a mascot that is endangered in China.)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Stronger than regular tissues
reviews.reviewText: The one thing I am most impressed with when it comes to this product is the softness to strength ratio! These tissues are just as soft as regular ones but much stronger! They don't disintegrate like the usual ones. Comes in handy for those super strong got to get the goop out nose blows! I've ordered several times already.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Thick and soft
reviews.reviewText: I like these better than traditional tissue.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: could be softer but they are good
